column1: 4.6.2	  Prostate-specific angtigen and the probability of PCa  The role of PSA in the diagnosis of PCa is presented by the EAU Guidelines on Prostate Cancer [60]. The   potential benefits and harms of using serum PSA testing to diagnose PCa in men with LUTS should be   discussed with the patient.
Measure prostate-specific antigen (PSA) if a diagnosis of prostate cancer will change   management.
Measure PSA if it assists in the treatment and/or decision-making process.
Counsel patients about PSA testing and the implications of a raised PSA test.
